result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanna Estrada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Great Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalty - Operatew/o License & Cause Bodily Harm], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution in full plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a 500 word apology letter to victim. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.
Defendant can apply in writing to the court for Youthful Expungment upon successful completion of probation and all conditions.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. Must report to jail by 1/02/15.
To perform 150 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joanna Estrada in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses 14-TR-1688 & 1689 but reads in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders Defendant to submit DNA sample. Victim makes statement to the court. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benenfit of a PSI. Atty Fagundes reads letter prepared by defendant apologizing to the victim and court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defendant Joanna Estrada in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with J.E.     Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license including insurance.

Defendant Joanna Estrada in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond set.
Defendant was fingerprinted 7/09/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 12/30/14)
